text: Cheryl Murphy (born October 17, 1978) is an American martial artist. She is a member of Team USA and a current Shotokan Karate fighter. She is stated to be a world class competition kumite competitor. == Personal life == She was born in Olympia, Washington and resides in Queens, NY. She received her master's degree in Community Health at Long Island University. == Career == She competes in the division. Murphy has been a member of the Senior US Team since 2002. Murphy is ranked by the World Karate Federation She won the national division, US Open, and a gold medal in the 2012 Pan Americans. Murphy competed in the fifth World University Karate Championships in New York. She has held numerous top 5 rankings in Karate In 2011, she finished 9th in the Pan Am games She competed at the Karate at the 2013 World Combat Games, winning a bronze medal. She is strong advocate of Karate being inducted into the Olympic Games and now works for FNB as a Quartz CFC person ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Sportspeople from Olympia, Washington Category:Living people Category:American female karateka Category:Shotokan practitioners Category:Pan American Games medalists in karate Category:Pan American Games bronze medalists for the United States Category:Karateka at the 2003 Pan American Games Category:Karateka at the 2011 Pan American Games
title: Cheryl Murphy
